thread.title: WHO gets approval to use Ebola vaccine in Democratic Republic of Congo

title: WHO gets approval to use Ebola vaccine in Democratic Republic of Congo
text:
May 14, 2018 / 1:07 PM / Updated 10 minutes ago WHO gets approval to use Ebola vaccine in Democratic Republic of Congo Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
GENEVA, May 14 (Reuters) - The World Health Organization has a green light from Democratic Republic of Congo to import and use an experimental Ebola vaccine in the country, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus told reporters on Monday.
“We have agreement, registration, plus import permit, everything formally agreed already,” Tedros said. “All is ready now to really use it,” he said, adding that the Congolese government deserved praise for its response to the outbreak. (Reporting by Tom Miles, Editing by William Maclean)
